title: Watch It Burn
excerpt: Two scammers, a web of betrayal, and Europe’s fraud of the century.

title: Master of Make-Believe
excerpt: Zach Horwitz came to Los Angeles hoping to make it in the movies. He ended up running a seven-hundred-million-dollar scam, defrauding a sprawling group of investors, starting with his best friends.

title: There Are Places You Cannot Go
excerpt: A friendship born out of the ruins of a nation, a dangerous journey home, and a 40-year search for the truth.

title: Poison Pill
excerpt: Is the killer behind the 1982 Tylenol poisonings still on the loose? Exclusive revelations by investigators yield the first authoritative account of what happened and who likely did it.

title: ‘Stay Away From Him. He’s Dangerous.’
excerpt: "For years, a mysterious figure preyed on gay men in Atlanta. People on the streets called him the Handcuff Man—but the police knew his real name."

title: A Teen’s Fatal Plunge Into the London Underworld
excerpt: After Zac Brettler mysteriously plummeted into the Thames, his grieving parents discovered that he’d been posing as an oligarch’s son. Would the police help them solve the puzzle of his death?

title: Kyle Deschanel, the Rothschild Who Wasn’t
excerpt: Kyle de Rothschild Deschanel was an instant New York sensation who seemed to live on a 24/7 carousel of mega-dollar deals and raucous parties. Then his best friend found an ID marked “Aryeh Dodelson.”

title: 12 Gripping True-Crime Reads
excerpt: For some of us, dark times call for dark reads.

title: Notes From the Inner Lives of Con Artists
excerpt: Venture inside the minds of some of the greatest scammers.

title: The Last Gamble of Tokyo Joe
excerpt: Ken Eto rose through the ranks of the Chicago mob, and then it tried to kill him. The underworld would never be the same.

title: How a Team of Ambitious Crooks in 1960s Montreal Planned the Biggest Bank Heist Anyone Had Ever Seen
excerpt: In the spring of 1961, Georges Lemay, a dapper thirty-six-year-old French Canadian, spent his days holed up in his cottage on a private island on a river in the Laurentian Mountains north of Montre…

title: Crime of the Centuries
excerpt: Tomb raiders, crooked art dealers, and museum curators fed billionaire Michael Steinhardt’s addiction to antiquities. Many also happened to be stolen.

title: 11 of the Greatest Scams of All Time, Curated by ‘Scam Goddess’ Laci Mosley
excerpt: The comedian and podcast host—and bonafide scam expert—shares her favorite capers, along with what makes them so irresistible.

title: How the Biggest Fraud in German History Unravelled
excerpt: The tech company Wirecard was embraced by the German élite. But a reporter discovered that behind the façade of innovation were lies and links to Russian intelligence.

title: Avenging Billy: How amateur sleuths took on a gay porn actor’s haunting Hollywood murder
excerpt: Local sleuths help find a suspect in gay porn actor Bill Newton's murder. His dismembered head and feet were found in a Hollywood dumpster in 1990.

title: The husband-and-wife forgers who fooled the art market — and made millions | CNN
excerpt: Wolfgang and Helene Beltracchi’s forgeries infiltrated museums, auction houses and private collections. A decade after their conviction, psychoanalyst Jeannette Fischer asks: Why did they do it?

title: The Spectacular Case of Lørenskog: Norway's Ongoing Search for a Murderer
excerpt: Anne-Elisabeth Hagen, 68, was married to one of the wealthiest men in Norway. But four years ago, she disappeared, and police still have no solid leads. The entire country has been obsessed by the case ever since.

title: The Most Lawless County in Texas
excerpt: Suzanne Wooten did the impossible and became the first candidate to defeat a sitting judge in Collin County. What followed is the unbelievable, epic tale of the craziest case in the history of jurisprudence.

title: A Cold Case
excerpt: Suddenly, a New York cop remembered a long-ago double murder.

title: Family, identity and one of the longest manhunts in U.S. history
excerpt: Fifty years ago, a shooting that nearly killed police officer Daril Cinquanta set in motion a decadeslong chase across the American West

title: “The Only Thing I Knew How to Do Was Kill People”: Inside the Rash of Unexp
excerpt: Dozens of people were killed, died by suicide, or went missing from the Texas military base last year alone. What is behind the violence and tragedy at Fort Hood?

title: Three Family Members, One Business. Robbing Armored Cars.
excerpt: A man returns home from the army and gets a surprising offer from his father: Join the family business and help mom & pop pull off a string of daring cross-country heists. No one expects the betrayals coming.

title: Cryptoqueen: How this woman scammed the world, then vanished - BBC News
excerpt: How did Ruja Ignatova make $4bn selling her fake cryptocurrency to the world - and where did she go?

title: Tome Raiders: Solving the Great Book Heist
excerpt: When nearly $3.5M of rare books were stolen in an audacious heist at Feltham in 2017, police wondered, what’s the story?
